explanation: Agent A’s claim is not correct. The cast-to-void idiom (void)dir; is an explicit acknowledgement of an unused parameter and is used only to suppress compiler warnings; it is an intentional no-op rather than inadvertent dead code. MISRA’s intent with Rule 2.2 is to forbid inadvertent code whose execution has no effect on program behaviour. Using (void)param; is an established, explicit use to document/acknowledge non-use of a parameter. If a project policy prefers, the parameter name can be omitted or a project-wide UNUSED macro can be used, but the presence of (void)dir; in this function does not constitute a MISRA 2023 Rule 2.2 violation in practice.
